google_reviews.author: Tiffany Varker
google_reviews.review:
We lived at Bellingham Green for one year (it was transitional for us after a move from out of the area until we purchased a house). Our experience was great! The townhouse was beautiful, tons of natural light from windows on 3 sides. A beautiful wooded area is to one side of the property, with a family of resident deer. Neighbors were friendly and respectful. Danny and Samantha are the owner and property manager, respectively, and were super easy to work with, very responsive and worked with us on our home buying timeline. This is one of very few pet friendly complexes in the area, so there are a lot of dogs (we have one too, that's one reason we chose to live there). There are dog waste stations located on the property and it's close to a couple walking trails. Community garden area is very nice amenity. The one drawback is the proximity to Bakerview Rd - it can get pretty noisy at times.
We love our new house, but if we found ourselves in need of an apartment, we would definitely call Samantha!

google_reviews.author: Amy Phillips
google_reviews.review: I wanted to share my pleasurable experience of living at Bellingham Green for the past year. Samantha and Danny were easy to work with and always responsive to any needs or concerns I had which were few if any. I appreciated the fact that they were dog friendly especially with a 76 lb lab which was not easy to find in Bellingham.nowadays The majority of places had so many restrictions but not them they worked with me and had no issue with my request. Also, their rental rates were fair and reasonable for such a nice apartment complex. I highly recommend Bellingham Green as a place to stay.

Good

Bellingham Green has received positive feedback from tenants, highlighting the property management's conducive living environment. Residents have noted the beauty of the townhouses, especially the natural light that fills the spaces from windows on three sides. The shared experience of living near friendly and respectful neighbors contributes to the sense of community that new tenants appreciate. The property is also recognized for being pet-friendly, accommodating larger dog breeds, which is often a significant factor in lease decisions for many tenants.

Additionally, tenants have praised the responsiveness of the property management, specifically mentioning the owner and property manager's willingness to work with tenants on any requests. One former resident shared how easy it was to coordinate leasing with their home-buying timeline, showcasing a personalized approach to tenant needs. The amenities, such as dog waste stations and a pleasant community garden, further enhance the appeal of the property, making it a desirable living space.

Great

This article’s intent is to showcase the exemplary aspects of living at Bellingham Green, underlined by strong management and community features. Tenants have reported exceptional experiences during their time at the property, noting that the management team is always available to address any concerns. The favorable rental rates compared to the amenities provided add to the value perceived by tenants, reinforcing that they receive a good return on their housing investment.

Moreover, tenants expressed a positive sentiment about the outdoor environment, particularly the scenic wooded area and local wildlife such as deer. This serene setting, combined with the friendly atmosphere, creates a perfect backdrop for both families and individuals seeking a community-oriented lifestyle. The combination of great management, pet policies, and appealing amenities has set Bellingham Green apart as a standout property in the Bellingham rental market.

Bad

Although Bellingham Green has garnered mostly positive reviews, there are some minor drawbacks that have been mentioned. A common concern highlighted by a resident is the noise from nearby Bakerview Rd, which could affect the tranquility of living at the complex. While the property boasts many attractive features, the sound level at certain times can detract from the overall experience for those sensitive to noise.

It's also worth noting that while the reviews have been overwhelmingly positive, the limited number of reviews means that there might be areas needing improvement that have not been highlighted by current or past residents. As with any property, potential tenants should thoroughly investigate recent feedback to ensure that the experience aligns with their preferences.

Ugly

In this article, it is essential to address the lack of any troubling reviews or significant complaints about Bellingham Green. All feedback available indicates a level of satisfaction from tenants, particularly in terms of the management's responsiveness and the property's amenities. However, the absence of diverse reviews means that potential issues may not have been publicly documented, leaving a gap in information that future tenants might find critical.

Furthermore, without any concrete negative feedback, it is difficult to ascertain the underlying issues that might exist. Tenants are encouraged to approach with realistic expectations and to conduct thorough research to ensure their needs will be met based on their unique lifestyle. This absence of heavy criticism can be seen as a positive, but it's equally essential to acknowledge that every property has room for improvement.
